column1: Our new foundation degree in Story: Narrative and Communication offers an opportunity for professional development for people who use storytelling
column2: narrative and role play in a range of occupational settings. This work-based study programme has been developed with employers to provide relevant professional training for those working in libraries
column4: museums and galleries; community arts projects; schools
column5: nurseries and after-school clubs; homes for senior citizens; public health; hospices; social inclusion; places of worship; community centres; prisons; radio and TV.

column2: inform and communicate in creative ways. You will learn how to use storytelling as a personal and professional skill
column3: one that will help you to continue to reflect on your work and working environment
column4: and enable you to transfer your skills to voluntary activity
column5: such as community regeneration. The ethical issues that underlie storytelling will be addressed throughout the course. The taught element of the foundation degree is delivered on a part-time basis over a period of two years.  It includes the development of a learning journal and short courses covering a range of subjects related to the principles and practice of storytelling and its wider application.
